intro: Tricalysia obanensis, commonly known as the Oban orchid, is a rare and endangered flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are elongated and strap-like, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Tricalysia obanensis is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
